functions.rule: combined with a verb in the Conj-I mood
functions.exampleen: it can go into it

functions.rule: conbines with e.g. Purp or Impv
functions.exampleen: it must rain, it is getting ready to rain

functions.rule: combines with masdar or Cnd
functions.exampleen: it was possible for me to go

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: It’s me who has done it.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and main verb in Cnd mood
functions.exampleen: I had to wait

functions.rule: rule
functions.exampleen: I am

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: do

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: En dus, in die woorde van voormalige President Mandela, “[durf] ons nie talm nie, want ons lang pad is nog nie verby nie”.
functions.exampleen: And so, in the words of former President Mandela, “we dare not linger, for our long road is not yet over”.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Toegang tot gesondheids- en onderwysgeriewe [het] verbeter.
functions.exampleen: Access to health and education facilities has improved.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Deur saam te werk, [kan] ons meer bereik.
functions.exampleen: By working together, we can achieve more.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.exampleen: What expenses may be claimed?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Die Regering [moet] vinniger, harder en slimmer werk.
functions.exampleen: The Government must work faster, harder and smarter.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Ons langtermyn-infrastruktuurprogram [sal] ons help om vinniger te groei.
functions.exampleen: Our long-term infrastructure program will help us grow faster.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: Laat ons altyd gereed [wees] om die polisie van inligting oor misdaadaktiwiteite te voorsien.
functions.exampleen: Let us always be ready to provide the police with information on criminal activities.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Ons [wil] ook grondhervornming en landbou-ondersteuningsprogramme beter integreer.
functions.exampleen: We also want to better integrate land reform and agricultural support programs.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Welvaart [word] geskep om mense se lewenskwaliteit te verbeter.
functions.exampleen: Wealth is created to improve people's quality of life.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: unknown

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: The room was paid for.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: šarru dannu šar māt Aššur šar kibrāt arba’i Šamšu kiššat nišī [anāku]
functions.exampleen: he is the king of Assyria

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with subjunctive marker and a finite form of the main verb
functions.example: [do] të m i japish tre dardha per at
functions.exampleen: you will give me three pears for that

functions.rule: combination of progressive particle and non-finite verb form
functions.example: aty ishte ni bujk [duke] velur dardha:
functions.exampleen: there was a farmer harvesting pears

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: the movie was without sound

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the non-finite form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: (they) have gone

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the non-finite form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: (he/she) has seen

functions.rule: combination of progressive particle with finite verb form
functions.example: y:shtë: ni nje:ri që [po] vilte da:dha
functions.exampleen: it was a man who was picking pears

functions.rule: combination of progressive particle and the non-finite verb form
functions.exampleen: the man (who is) collecting pears

functions.rule: combination of the reflexive particle and a finite verb form
functions.exampleen: and then the film finished

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: What [will] happen?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: የበለጠ ችሮታ ለማድረግ የሚችልበትን ዘዴ ባገኝ [ብሎ] ተመኘ ።
functions.exampleen: [He wished] he could find a way to do better.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: You cannot blame me for being lazy.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: ሰርቼ እንኳን ቢሆን ኑሮ ብድሬን እከፍል [ነበር] ።
functions.exampleen: Even if I did, I would still pay my living wages.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Milk is white.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Kassa [did not] eat lunch with his mother.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: After a little practice, they did it better.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive (verbal noun) of the main verb
functions.exampleen: Travel [must be] in the morning.
functions.comment: Page 477 of Grover Hudson. 1997. Amharic and Argobba. In: Robert Hetzron (ed.) The Semitic Languages. Routledge, London/New York, ISBN 978-0-415-41266-7.

functions.rule: combination of the main verb stem, the auxiliary stem, and the subject agreement morphemes
functions.exampleen: I will finish the job for the boy.
functions.comment: Used in nonpast conjugation as an affirmative main verb and except when part of a compound verb. See page 472 of Grover Hudson. 1997. Amharic and Argobba. In: Robert Hetzron (ed.) The Semitic Languages. Routledge, London/New York, ISBN 978-0-415-41266-7.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: My father is cooler than yours.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Ne Petrus Smiþ ne Maria Brun mihton [beon] ȝecorene .
functions.exampleen: Neither Peter Smith nor Mary Brown could be selected.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Peteres neah-ȝebur [hæfð] þone eodor readne onȝemet.
functions.exampleen: Peter's neighbor has painted the fence red.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Ne Petrus Smiþ ne Maria Brun [mihton] beon ȝecorene .
functions.exampleen: Neither Peter Smith nor Mary Brown could be selected.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: They have not painted.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: For sume ƿisan [nolde] seo don sƿa.
functions.exampleen: For some reason she wouldn't do so.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Þis ærend-ƿrit is fram Petere and hit [ƿæs] ȝebroht ȝierstan-dæg.
functions.exampleen: This letter is from Peter and it was brought yesterday.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.exampleen: Will you go?

functions.rule: preceeds first person plural verb form
functions.exampleen: [Let's] make a really big house.
functions.comment: In some variants of the language this is represented by a prefix

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and adjective or noun in positive polarity

functions.rule: after verbs
functions.exampleen: Jaguar sleeps

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Konibu is coming back alone

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: He is going to stick the basket

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: My father gave me a shirt.

functions.rule: positive imperatives
functions.exampleen: Pour the milk into the glass!

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: I'm a teacher.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: AUX form for first person plural future
functions.exampleen: They left it to use to take care of the earth.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: They are swimming.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of form of main verb with final -i plus auxiliary
functions.exampleen: They will keep on defending their territory.

functions.rule: followed by lexical verb in the gerund

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Then this white man said/did

functions.rule: combines with any non-finite verb.
functions.exampleen: Deniz may not be able to sleep on time.
functions.comment: Function should probably be specified better.

functions.rule: This is more like a negative copula, it can get many other TAME features as affixes.
functions.exampleen: The results have been announced, haven’t they?

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: This is an auxiliary that can take (almost) any of the TAME affixes.
functions.exampleen: Deniz will have asleep.
functions.comment: Full set of functions are not specified.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: We wouldn't be here

functions.rule: used with third person subject before a verb
functions.exampleen: We cannot see it

functions.rule: Compounds with the main verb with -ti- ligature form.
functions.exampleen: and everything explodes [as it happens].

functions.rule: precedes a verb in the optative mood
functions.exampleen: let's dance!

functions.rule: attaches to the right of the future form of the verb
functions.exampleen: It wants to say place of bones

functions.rule: attaches to the right of a verb after the ligature -ti-

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: мы маглі [б] працаваць разам з вамі
functions.exampleen: we could work with you

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Вядома, такі праект быў [бы] немагчымы без падтрымкі нашых партнёраў: Аліварыя і Euroradio.
functions.exampleen: Of course, such a project would be impossible without the support of our partners: Olivaria and Euroradio.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: Пры гэтым сірыйскія прэпараты [будуць] даступныя ў беларускіх аптэках.
functions.exampleen: At the same time, Syrian drugs will be available in Belarusian pharmacies.

functions.rule: combination of a future form of the auxiliary and an infinitive of an imperfective main verb
functions.example: Пры чым гэтыя рэкамендацыі [будуць] тычыцца абодвух бакоў.
functions.exampleen: At what these recommendations will concern both parties.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a passive participle of a main verb
functions.exampleen: The revolt was brutally suppressed by the Soviet occupiers.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: pronominal copula may be used in the present tense
functions.example: Усе лекцыі напоўнены энерджайзерамі, з дапамогай якіх усе пазнаёмяцца паміж сабою, а кантакты ў наш час - [гэта] вельмі важна.
functions.exampleen: All lectures are filled with energizers, with which everyone will get to know each other, and contacts nowadays are very important.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Парламентът в момента е много необективен и не [би] избрал добър президент.
functions.exampleen: Parliament is currently very biased and would not elect a good president.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a passive participle of the main verb
functions.example: Когато катализаторите се повредят - те просто [биват] сваляни.
functions.exampleen: When the catalysts are damaged, they are simply removed.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: Предполага се, че лятото ще [бъде] горещо.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a passive participle of the main verb
functions.example: Книгата беше прочетена, преди да [бъде] купена.
functions.exampleen: The book was read before it was bought.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.exampleen: This is our common interest with Bulgaria.

functions.rule: combination of a finite form of the auxiliary and a past participle of a main verb
functions.example: При стареца [бе] останала Христина, хубавата му внучка.
functions.exampleen: Christina, his beautiful granddaughter, had stayed with the old man.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a passive participle of the main verb
functions.example: Книгата [беше] прочетена, преди да бъде купена.
functions.exampleen: The book was read before it was bought.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with a present finite form of the main verb
functions.example: В събота разкъсана облачност [ще] има в Югозападна България.
functions.exampleen: On Saturday there will be scattered clouds in Southwestern Bulgaria.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: जरूरी ईहो बा कि जवन काम हो रहल [बा] ओकरा के कम से कम झंडावाला लोग जरूर पढ़सु ।
functions.exampleen: It is important that youth work should be done at least.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: Furu [bè] siri, i [bè] taga a nòfè.
functions.exampleen: Marriage binds, you go behind him.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: Ko e [bèna] ne sòrò so kònò.
functions.exampleen: You will get me into the house.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: Syèdennin [ka] yèlè ka yèlè ka yèlè.
functions.exampleen: Chick laughing and laughing and laughing.
functions.comment: The auxiliary is used in multiple contexts, marking infinitive or subjunctive but also optative and simple affirmative.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: Aw [kana] n faga, ne ma ko kè.
functions.exampleen: Do not kill me, I have not taken care of my affairs.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Nobody has known your name.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: His two eyes [are not] good.
functions.comment: Glossed QUAL.NEG, i.e., negative auxiliary for qualifying (stative) verbs. In the example, nyi is a verb meaning to be good.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: A [mana] den min wolo, a bè o dun.
functions.exampleen: It eats the baby that she would give birth to.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: [Will] that settlement be found?
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, na means to come. As an auxiliary, it is glossed CERT (I do not know what the abbreviation means). It can be used as a future affirmative auxiliary (shortcut for bɛ́na). In some sentences it seems to also have an irrealis/conditional flavor.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: Syèfan ani syèdennin o [tun] tagara lenburukariyòrò.
functions.exampleen: So the egg went on citrus.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: The egg did not rise.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.exampleen: Because he will not return to let his oldest brother rest, he also goes to search for the little girl, he also helps with that.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: This has eaten this.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive or participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: I want to see you.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Can you sing?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an imperfect participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: You will have to stay a bit longer.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.comment: It is an auxiliary only in contexts where it combines with an infinitive of another verb (without a preposition or subordinating conjunction; also, the infinitive should not head an indirect question).

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: You [can] come.
functions.comment: It is the aorist equivalent of the verb izan (“to be”). While both verbs have full conjugations, the most common use of edin is to replace the potential forms of izan, which are seen as archaic/literary.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb
functions.example: Aurten izan [ditudan] aukera apurrak ondo baliatu [ditudala] uste dut.
functions.exampleen: I think I took full advantage of the few opportunities I had this year.
functions.comment: The transitive auxiliary. Used with verbs that take a dative argument. As a lexical verb, edun means to have.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb
functions.example: Gure erreboltak frakasatu duenez, aldegin [dezagun] Pekin-era.
functions.exampleen: As our revolt has failed, [let] us flee to Beijing.
functions.comment: Present imperative form of izan. Linguistically, this verb form can be seen as belonging to the reconstructed citation form ezan instead of izan.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the perfective present of the auxiliary and an apocopated infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary in perfective present and the main verb in imperfective present

functions.comment: As a lexical verb, داشتن (“dâštan”) means “to have”.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.comment: See https://www.jahanshiri.ir/fa/en/verb-passive. The auxiliary verb شدن (“šodan”; to get, become) is lemmatized as کرد in the Seraji treebank, perhaps because it replaces it when compound verbs are passivized. In compound verbs, the compound:lvc relation should be used instead of aux or aux:pass.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb

functions.comment: As a lexical verb, گردیدن (“gardidan”) means “to turn”.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb

functions.comment: As a lexical verb, گشتن (“gaštan”) means “to turn”.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a connegative form of the verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with first infinitive

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Now, [is] that your new car?
functions.comment: the copula is used to link between two nominative arguments, but it may also link a nominative and an essive. It is not, however, the same usage as the third person singular existential on, which is used existentially and in have constructions where it can take objects: minut, sinut...

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary nonpast and past with past participle of main verb

functions.rule: Combined with a gerund to express future.
functions.example: PSA e a Zona Franca [acabarán] entendéndose, pero para iso tiveron que escenificar antes o seu desencontro nos medios.
functions.exampleen: PSA and the Zona Franca will eventually understand each other, but for that they had to stage their disagreement in the media first.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.exampleen: Companies had to create a job to answer resumes.

functions.rule: Deixar de forms a cessative periphrasis when combined with an infinitive.
functions.example: Que isto o diga alguén que vai dirixir unha delegación do Instituto Cervantes non [deixa] de ser un bo despropósito.
functions.exampleen: That this is said by someone who will lead a delegation from the Instituto Cervantes is still a good nonsense.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: Haber que combined with an infinitive.
functions.example: Digo eu que [haberá] que falar, procurar unha nova localización.
functions.exampleen: I say we will have to talk, look for a new location.

functions.rule: An inflected form of the verb ir expresses tense and person when combined with an infinitive.
functions.example: O problema é que, cando morramos os que agora [imos] seguir cobrando, rematan eses ingresos.
functions.exampleen: The problem is that when those of us who are going to continue earning die, these incomes will end.

functions.rule: Levar combines with a gerung to express an iterative process.
functions.example: Hai anos que Riera [leva] traballando con discreción e eficacia coa finalidade de que as principais empresas fornecedoras da cadea de montaxe de PSA poidan instalarse en Vigo.
functions.exampleen: Riera has been working discreetly and efficiently for years, so that the main companies that supply the PSA assembly line can settle in Vigo.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: She seemed to want it.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: A denuncia a tempo tamén [pode] gañar unha batalla.
functions.exampleen: Timely denunciation can also win a battle.

functions.rule: Combination with a past participle of the main verb.
functions.example: Outros compañeiros que poderían [quedar] relegados nas próximas listas.
functions.exampleen: Other colleagues could be relegated to the next lists.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Pasarán uns meses intensos moendo nos a cabeza para que interioricemos as maldades de o que [queren] atacar.
functions.exampleen: They will spend a few intense months grinding our heads so that we internalize the evils of what they want to attack.

functions.rule: Seguir combined with the main verb (in gerund) expresses a progressive action.
functions.example: Hoxe en día é moi distinto, e na ikebana hai moitísimas mulleres, pero os seus grandes mestres aínda [seguen] sendo homes.
functions.exampleen: Today it is very different, and in ikebana there are many women, but its great masters are still men.

functions.rule: It combines with an infinitive main verb.
functions.example: O optimismo [semella] desatarse nas fileiras socialistas e nacionalistas
functions.exampleen: Optimism seems to be unleashed among the socialist and nationalist militants...

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: A súa desaparición [é] un logro europeo que defendo.
functions.exampleen: His disappearance is a European achievement that I advocate.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: Un acaba escollendo a opción que lle parece menos mala pero nunca está moi seguro de [ter] escollido ben.
functions.exampleen: One ends up choosing the option that seems least bad to him but one is never very sure that he has chosen well.

functions.rule: It expresses an iterative process when combined with a gerund (main verb).
functions.example: Xosé Bugallo [vén] facendo diversos chamamentos a ambos os partidos.
functions.exampleen: Xosé Bugallo has been making various appeals to both parties.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: thou art in the way with him

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a finite form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: I will sell a horse.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a finite form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: They sent medicine along.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: Σαῦλος δὲ [ἦν] συνευδοκῶν τῇ ἀναιρέσει αὐτοῦ
functions.exampleen: And Saul was consenting unto his death.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a participle of the main verb
functions.example: νῦν δ̓ ἡνίκ̓ ἄθλων τῶνδ̓ ὑπερτελὴς ἔφυ, ἐνταῦθα δὴ μάλιστα ταρβήσασ̓ [ἔχω].
functions.exampleen: Now I am the champion of the most powerful athletes, but I [have] not even eaten.

functions.rule: perfect of come
functions.example: ઘટના બાદ પોલીસ દ્વારા તુરંત જ ગામમાં અને આસપાસના વિસ્તારમાં લોખંડી બંદોબસ્ત ગોઠવી દેવામાં [આવ્યો] હતો.
functions.exampleen: After the incident, the police immediately set up an iron barricade in the village and surrounding area.

functions.rule: used in perfect sense
functions.example: હું પહોંચી ના વળ્યો કારણકે તે ખૂબ ઝડપી દોડી [ગયો].
functions.exampleen: I was n't able to keep up , because he ran too fast.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: મારા પપ્પા તારા (પપ્પા) કરતાં વધારે કૂલ [છે].
functions.exampleen: My dad [is] cooler than yours.

functions.rule: used to indicate necessitative token
functions.example: તેણે તેનાં વાળ ઓળતા હોવા [જોઈતા] હતા પણ કોઈ કારણથી તે દિવસે તેણે ન કર્યાં.
functions.exampleen: She should have been doing her hair but for some reason she would n't that day.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: પીટર સ્મિથ કે મેરી બ્રાઉનમાંથી કોઈની પસંદગી ના [થઈ] શકી.
functions.exampleen: Neither Peter Smith nor Mary brown could be selected.

functions.rule: perfect aspect
functions.example: પીટર અને મૅરી ભેટ્યા એકબીજાને અને પછી કક્ષ છોડી [દીધો].
functions.exampleen: Peter and Mary hugged each other and then left the room.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: કુલદીપ સેંગર સહિત કોઈ પર હત્યાનો આરોપ [નહીં].
functions.exampleen: No one, including Kuldeep Sengar, was charged with murder.

functions.rule: obligatory emphasis on the main verb
functions.exampleen: I had to say.

functions.rule: Usually used to determine progressive aspect
functions.exampleen: it is rain[ing].

functions.rule: AUX presenting a possibility of some event
functions.example: પીટર સ્મિથ કે મેરી બ્રાઉનમાંથી કોઈની પસંદગી ના થઈ [શકી].
functions.exampleen: Neither Peter Smith nor Mary Brown could be selected.

functions.rule: Interrogative AUX, like do
functions.exampleen: Do you want to go?

functions.rule: indicates past
functions.example: તેણે તેનાં વાળ ઓળતા હોવા જોઈતા [હતા] પણ કોઈ કારણથી તે દિવસે તેણે ન કર્યાં.
functions.exampleen: She should have done her hair but for some reason she would n't that day .

functions.rule: aux indicating necessity of the main verb
functions.example: તેણે તેનાં વાળ ઓળતા [હોવા] જોઈતા હતા.
functions.exampleen: He [should] have combed his hair.

functions.rule: the auxiliary follows the main verb and both are conjugated
functions.exampleen: Jose's wife arrives to the water

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb in present tense
functions.exampleen: he is coming

functions.rule: combines with a conjugated verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary verb with a conjugated main verb

functions.rule: After main verb
functions.exampleen: He/She picked it up

functions.rule: Combination of the auxiliary with a conjugated main verb

functions.rule: Combination of the auxiliary with a conjugated main verb

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a present participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form an obligative necessitative (supposed to)

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used in the present tense only with gender and number agreement
functions.example: לא ברור אם השימוש בזמן הריון או הנקה [הוא] בטוח עבור התינוק.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Turns out I was innocent.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used in the present tense only with gender and number agreement, positive only
functions.exampleen: The orange is a clear winter fruit

functions.rule: used between a subject and predicate which is not a finite verb
functions.deficient: used in the present tense only
functions.exampleen: Being gay friendly is being modern

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a right potential (entitled)
functions.exampleen: He is entitled to go

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a mandatory necessitative (must)
functions.exampleen: He is required to go

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a neutral modal potential of ability, possibility etc.
functions.example: כל התשובות שראש הממשלה לא [יכל] לתת
functions.exampleen: All of the answers that the prime minister could not give

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to indicate a willingness
functions.exampleen: He is willing to go

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a mandated necessitative (forced to)
functions.exampleen: He must go

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a risk potential (prone to)

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a potential of ability (capable)

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a negative prosody potential, i.e. might INF with unexpressed (unfortunately)

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a dubitative potential (might but more probably not)

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a future

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a future expectation

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a necessitative

functions.rule: combined with infinitive to form a permissive potential (may)

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a perfective participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a perfective participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary, the stem of the main verb and the auxiliary hai-tha

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combines with a past participle of the main verb

functions.comment: Lehet is a separate lemma in the data, not just an irregular potential form of van.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.comment: The verb lehet is used impersonally. Otherwise, potential can also be expressed using the suffix -hat/-het, followed by regular conjugation: mehetek means “I can/may go”.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: He [will be] a teacher.
functions.comment: Lesz is a separate lemma in the data. Some descriptions would have it as the irregular future form of the verb van. It can also be translated as to become, and it even has the past tense forms, but we do not distinguish the two meaning shades. Hence, unlike in other languages, the Hungarian equivalent of to become can be treated as a copula.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: Auxiliaries need to be memorised. There is no rule for which of the auxiliaries is required.
functions.exampleen: Bees have sharp teeth

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: Unpredictable rule. Which auxiliary a verb used needs to be memorised.
functions.exampleen: I took off a layer

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: I want to go.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and VERB
functions.exampleen: would be held

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: Everyone will die.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB or ADJ
functions.exampleen: This can be divided into three parts.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: together as inggih punika is used in Krama level language only.
functions.example: Galileo Galilei [inggih] punika bapak ageng ing hidrostatika.
functions.exampleen: Galileo Galilei was a great figure in hydrostatics.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: Euryarchaeota can survive in extreme environments.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: Dracula can be exterminated.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: This criteria has been implemented.

functions.rule: combination o fthe auxiliary and a verb
functions.exampleen: it [can] even be said

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: must be redeemed

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: Snoopy is dreaming of becoming a writer.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and verb or adjective
functions.exampleen: He must have taken a bath

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB or ADJ
functions.example: Nao [mesti] ngerti posisi endas, awak, sikil lan tangan.
functions.exampleen: Nao must know the position of his head, body, legs and arms.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: He/she want to be a singer.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: Radio could be operated.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: The guests have arrived.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a VERB
functions.exampleen: The children have come.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used for Ngoko level language only.
functions.exampleen: The capacity of the 705 series is 75 passengers.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used in present, past and future tenses
functions.exampleen: He/she/it is a human; He/she/it was a human; He/she/it will be a human

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a finite main verb in presence, future or past
functions.exampleen: I must take care of him

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary (in passive voice) and a past participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: a crime [has been] commited

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.exampleen: he [has] finished grammar school

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: this is not true
functions.comment: Verbal noun version of the lemma used in the GNC treebank

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and main verb in Sub mood
functions.exampleen: it [might] be like that

functions.rule: conbination of auxiliary and subjunctive form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: it [might] rain
functions.comment: lemma is the verbal noun form

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: -ing

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: I am the chief.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Қой, қазақ бұлармен не ғып соғыса [алсын]?
functions.exampleen: What [can] a Kazakh do to fight them?
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, ал means to take.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: This figure will continue to grow in the future.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, бер means to give.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used when the suffixed copula -e- cannot provide the corresponding form
functions.exampleen: The Eurovision Song Contest 2010 will be the 55th Eurovision Song Contest.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.deficient: suffixed copula can provide only some forms
functions.example: Халықтың үміті мен Сіздің сеніміңізді ақтай алғаныма қуанышты [мын].
functions.exampleen: I am glad that I was able to live up to the expectations of the people and your trust.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Қазір 1 млрд. АҚШ долларына дейінгі қаражаты бар бірлескен қор құрылып [жатыр].
functions.exampleen: Now a joint fund with up to USD 1 billion [is] being established.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, жат means to lie down.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.exampleen: So we live.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, жүр means to walk.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the optative form of the main verb
functions.example: Біздің компания да осы процеске белсене қатысқысы [келеді].
functions.exampleen: Our company also wants to take an active part in this process.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, кел means to come.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Дмитрий Медведевтің Астанаға сапары 22 мамырға жоспарланып [отыр].
functions.exampleen: Dmitry Medvedev's visit to Astana is scheduled for May 22.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, otyr means to sit.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Соған қарамастан мен тәртіп орнатуға қарсы үлкен қарсылықты сезіп [тұрмын].
functions.exampleen: Nevertheless, I feel great opposition to the establishment of order.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, тұр means to stand.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.exampleen: The middle of the century was approaching.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, қал means to remain.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: It was the month of April.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Kurdan bi vê rewşê bi cîranên xwe [daye] nasîn jî.
functions.exampleen: The Kurds have also introduced this situation to their neighbors.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, dan means to give.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: There [will] be no good communication.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Yanî sebeba mirina wê bi tu awayî ne [hate] seh kirin.
functions.exampleen: That is, the cause of her death has not [been] determined in any way.
functions.comment: As a lexical verb, hatin means to come.

functions.rule: Attached to the past verbal participle
functions.exampleen: He ran eight miles in two minutes
functions.comment: 810, Sridhar, S. N. (2007). Modern kannada grammar.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: I [want] to go to the Special Olympics.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: However, it [does] not go against the rules of God.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: The last 6 days was the third of the 24 seasons, Gyeong-chip.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: As a result, the inflow of foreign capital [is] rapidly increasing.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Audit [should] be done.

functions.rule: existential-possessive negative copula present; negative auxiliary and main verb in evidential past
functions.exampleen: He, it would seem, has never studied.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and present tense
functions.exampleen: Would you go?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and infinitive
functions.example: Кыдз тэ думайтан, кӧр тэ [верман] локны?
functions.exampleen: What do you think: when can you come?

functions.rule: past
functions.exampleen: where he had a bed on the ground

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and infinitive
functions.example: Сылӧ [коліс] басӧка лӧсьӧтны юрсисӧ, но мылякӧ сія лунӧ сылӧ эз вӧв охота сійӧ керны.
functions.exampleen: He/she was supposed to be doing his/her hair nicely, but for some reason he/she didn't feel like doing it that day.

functions.rule: followed by the word it negates, with possible interceeding adverbs
functions.deficient: used in copula negation but may have peculiarities of Russian
functions.exampleen: I am [not] here alone.

functions.rule: present
functions.exampleen: It is alway fun for a person, when

functions.rule: with converbs
functions.example: Сія пондыліс [овны] куриттӧг да вина ютӧг.
functions.exampleen: He began being without smoking and drinking liqueur.

functions.rule: used with following conneg form of verb in conneg form
functions.example: Висьтала тай, бур олан ӧтикӧ [эг] адззыв.
functions.exampleen: So I say, I really have [not] seen the good life.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and infinitive
functions.example: Эз [позь] бӧрйыны не Питер Смитӧс, не Мери Браунӧс.
functions.exampleen: He/she could choose neither Peter Smith nor Mary Brown.

functions.rule: existential-possessive negative copula present; negative auxiliary and main verb in evidential past
functions.exampleen: There is no one else in the village like him.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the conjugated or infinite main verb
functions.exampleen: ... [if we could] go to those places

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: Occurs in code-switching, not part of Komi system.
functions.exampleen: There were foxes, polar foxes, minks. (Sentence partially in Komi and Russian.)
functions.comment: Not a native copula for Komi, the exact method of annotation should be considered.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the conjugated main verb
functions.exampleen: Well, guys, let's sing a little, wouldn't you say?

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Ме, вокӧ, ог жӧ [вермы] овны Льӧмватӧгыс.
functions.exampleen: Brother, I just cannot be without Lyomva.

functions.rule: Habitual-distributional
functions.exampleen: During the festivals there have been demonstrations in the village.
functions.comment: example source: Челядьдырся азбука / Надежда Логинова // Войвыв кодзув (2015. No 3)

functions.rule: Habitual
functions.example: Менам татшӧм мича аканьыс некор на эз [вӧвлы]!
functions.exampleen: I haven't ever had that kind of beautiful doll.
functions.comment: example source: Мисьтӧм акань, Кирпиченко Т., Би кинь (2013. No1)

functions.rule: copula past and existential-possessive past
functions.exampleen: I had fun here...
functions.comment: example source: komicorpora.ru, Viktoria Mixajlova, Jölöga

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the conjugated main verb
functions.exampleen: it should be comprehensible to everyone
functions.comment: word may also occur as ajective

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: A тані [колӧ] шуны, мый вокъяс ордӧ зонкауловыд век вӧлі шӧтӧ-локтӧ.
functions.exampleen: But here it must be said that the young boys were always hanging around the brothers' place.

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Сійӧ ӧд оз [кут] виччысьны, кор ме дугда больгыны.
functions.exampleen: So he won't wait for me to stop chattering.
functions.comment: there is also future in referential past

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Everything will be fine.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and main verb in evidetial past
functions.exampleen: They will be changed for a mining furnace.

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Ӧткодявнысӧ он [лысьт] ӧнія уджсӧ да олӧмсӧ коркӧяыскӧд.
functions.exampleen: Now don't you dare go comparing his work and life of today with what it once was.

functions.rule: in combination with words other than finite verbs
functions.exampleen: We were not to go out...

functions.rule: in combination with negative focus
functions.exampleen: There was not a single little cloud in the sky to be seen.

functions.rule: Present tense
functions.example: Ӧти пу вылас [овлывлӧ] дас кык позйӧдз да унджык.
functions.exampleen: There are as many as 12 or even more nests per tree.
functions.comment: example source: Сьӧд рака / Ракин А. // Би кинь (2007. No 9)

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb in connegative form
functions.exampleen: They don't know fair play.
functions.comment: example source: komicorpora.ru, Selivanova, A. Bi kinj

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Иван Иванычьяс эз на миян бырны, но найӧс [позьӧ] эрдӧдны да зырны.
functions.exampleen: There is no end to our Ivan Ivanoviches, but they can be condemned and exhiled.

functions.rule: combination of the conjugated auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.example: Еджыд петукыс нырнас ӧшйис мӧдыслы сорс йылас, кыкнаныс усисны муӧ да [пондісны] сэк лёкысь пессьыны.
functions.exampleen: The white rooster grabbed to the other's comb with in his beak, the two of them fell to the ground and then began to fight terribly.
functions.comment: This might actually be more of an inchoative aspect marker

functions.rule: existential-possessive copula present
functions.exampleen: – Do you have some time to spare, Sasha?
functions.comment: example source: komicorpora.ru, Kodko, Vojvyv Kodzuv.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: — There is still a little water in the teapot.
functions.comment: Вежон кежлӧ том кадӧ / Петр Шахов // Войвыв кодзув (1971. No 7)

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a connegative form of the verb
functions.example: Myö [emmä] mäne kalalla, kun hilloh šuolla.
functions.exampleen: I [don't] sell fish when I'm fishing.
functions.comment: Expresses person but not mood, nor does it distinguish active from passive

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: It will be bright tomorrow.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the infinitive of the main verb
functions.exampleen: We [should] be more in the middle.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with first infinitive
functions.exampleen: Anyone [can] participate in the event.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a connegative form of the verb
functions.exampleen: Do[n't] go!
functions.comment: the auxiliary indicates person, number and mood

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.exampleen: Deniz cannot sleep.

functions.rule: It does not carry its literal meaning (to give) but instead modifies the main verb to indicate a benefactive auxiliary function.
functions.example: Дениз атасын ага китеп окуп [бер]ишин каалайт.
functions.exampleen: Deniz wants her/his father to read him/her (a) book.
functions.comment: MainVerb in converb form followed by auxiliary verb

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.exampleen: Deniz will have slept.

functions.rule: combination of all non-finete forms
functions.exampleen: Deniz cannot sleep.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.exampleen: Deniz did not not-see her/his mother.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.exampleen: Deniz did not see her/his mother.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs.
functions.example: Питер менен Мэри кучакташты, андан соң бѳлмѳдѳн чыгып [кет]ишти.
functions.exampleen: Peter and Mary hugged each other and then left the room.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.example: Мунун кѳгү жакшынакайыраак экен, мага кѳгүн берип [коё]суңбу?
functions.exampleen: The blue [one] of these is prettier, could you give me the blue one?

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.exampleen: I think that it is raining.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs
functions.example: Ал окугандары эмес, окуй [тур]гандары тууралуу айтып жатат.
functions.exampleen: They're telling me what they will read, not what they have read.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: Deniz was at home.

functions.rule: Combines with non-finete verbs

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary (only infinitive imperfective passive) and supine of the main verb. the resulting combination expresses also passive

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary (only infinitive imperfective passive) and supine of the main verb. the resulting combination expresses also future

functions.rule: Combination of the auxiliary and a perfect participle of the main verb, which agrees with the object in the accusative or is in the neuter case

functions.rule: Combination of an imperfective (later also perfective) form of the auxiliary with a perfective (and consequently passive) participle

functions.rule: Combination of the auxiliary with the so-called future (active) participle or the gerundive (passive)

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: The deficient copula paradigm degil is used to state the negative nonverbal predicates. It is not capable of taking a future tense suffix, unlike typical verbs (not grammatical: degilecek). Also, it does not accept any verb voice suffix too such as reciprocal (not grammatical: degilis).
functions.exampleen: It is [not] a time to go
functions.comment: This is exactly same with 'değil' indeed. However, Ottoman Turkish had two different letters to correspond 'ğ' in modern Turkish (tr). These are 'غ' and 'ك'. While the former was used if the adjacent vowel is back vowel, the latter was used when the adjacent vowel is a front vowel. After Turkish Republic, modern Turkish didn't make such a distinction though. Since in Ottoman Turkish Latin transcription alphabet, it is suggested to describe the word 'دكل' as 'degil', I used this notation.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: The deficient copula paradigm degyl is used to state negative nonverbal predicates. It is not capable of taking a future tense suffix, unlike typical verbs (e.g., degylecek). Also, it does not accept any verb voice suffixes (e.g., degylin). This copula was used in Old Anatolian Turkish and functions the same as degil.
functions.exampleen: I am [not] someone who will keep him alive
functions.comment: This is exactly the same as 'degil' indeed. 'Degul' was used in Old Anatolian Turkish.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of a main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of a main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of a subjunctive form of the auxiliary and an infinitive of a main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and an infinitive of the main verb

functions.rule: used with negation (man) and in irrealis

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a passive participle of a main verb

functions.rule: combination of a present participle of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of a present participle of the main verb and the auxilliary

functions.rule: combination of a present participle of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of a present participle of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: in conjunction with a main verb, often a Conv verb

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.comment: Unlike modern Irish, the copula inflects in Old Irish. In this case, the copula, 'is', represents the English 'it is'.

functions.rule: combination of a past participle of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of a gerund of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a past participle of the main verb
functions.example: ආරක්ෂක ලේකම්වරයා ඊට නිසි පිළිතුරු ලබා දී [තිබේ] .

functions.rule: combination of a past participle of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of a gerund of the main verb and the auxiliary

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: तिसते बाद ही इसदी गल्ल मन्नी [जाएं]।
functions.exampleen: Only then should it [be] obeyed.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: कराळी दे पत्तर भी घट्ट गिणतिया विच [थे]।
functions.exampleen: Karali's leaves [were] also in small numbers.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: दिन घरोणा लगी [पेया] तिज्जो घरे जो जाणा चाहिदा।
functions.exampleen: The day [is] getting dark and you should go home.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: कोई पैंती मिनटां तिकर घळाटी चलदी [रेह्यी]।
functions.exampleen: The beating [continued] for about fifty minutes.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: बल्कि मंत्रिमंडले विच एह हिस्सेदारी 40 प्रतिशत होई [सकदी] है।
functions.exampleen: Instead, the share in the cabinet [could] be 40 percent.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: काळुए दा एह पहला पक्का घर [है]।
functions.exampleen: This [is] Kalue's first concrete house.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: let him become accursed

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: if it has been done well

functions.rule: auxiliary combinied with a past participle
functions.exampleen: then the mount will have been purified

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: And God called the firmament Heaven.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with a non-finite (converb) form of the lexical verb
functions.exampleen: Masha can work

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and a converb form of the main verb
functions.exampleen: (s)he has to go, (s)he needs to go
functions.comment: the auxiliary takes agreement and TAME suffixes: хэсь [тарадм] I have to go

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary with a non-finite form of the lexical verb in the dative case
functions.exampleen: I want to eat.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: used in future tense and moods with NOUN and ADJ; also in locational predication with ADV
functions.exampleen: 'I will be a doctor'

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: The woman is beautiful.
functions.comment: The copula is used with stage-level predicates. The absence of the copula implies a individual-level predicate.

functions.rule: Both auxiliary and main verb are finite.
functions.exampleen: We are speaking Nheengatu.

functions.rule: The non-inflected form of the auxiliary is suffixed to the main verb.
functions.exampleen: I ordered a fire to be made.

functions.rule: The non-inflected form of the auxiliary is suffixed to the main verb.
functions.exampleen: He can walk.

functions.rule: The non-inflected form of the auxiliary is suffixed to the main verb.
functions.exampleen: He can walk.

functions.rule: Both auxiliary and main verb are finite.
functions.exampleen: We cannot eat cold food.

functions.rule: The non-inflected form of the auxiliary is suffixed to the main verb.
functions.exampleen: I want to return to my land.

functions.rule: combination of the finite forms of both auxiliary and main verb
functions.exampleen: The man will talk to us.

functions.rule: combination of the finite forms of both the main verb and auxiliary
functions.example: Tenki yasikari [yayuíri] awá taá upuderi umpinima aé.
functions.exampleen: We have to look again for who can write it.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Brother Qu [likes] to listen to Eason Chan.
functions.comment: Cantonese zung1ji3, meaning: to be to one's liking.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Don't go [for now].
functions.comment: Cantonese zyu6, meaning: Verb suffix indicating ongoing action's status.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: this form is used in colloquial Cantonese
functions.example: 剩落呢啲都[係]冇用㗎喇！
functions.exampleen: The rest are all unusable!
functions.comment: See https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues/653 for a discussion about Chinese copulas.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Lights [have not] been turned on!
functions.comment: Cantonese mou5, meaning: have not; did not (do something) (indicating non-completion of a verb).

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 爺爺，我[可唔可以]睇新一集嘅龍珠呀？
functions.exampleen: Grandpa, [can] I watch the new episode of Dragon Ball?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 呀，我喺廟街呢個行業[可能]已經有十七年。
functions.exampleen: Yeah, I've [probably] been in this business on Temple Street for seventeen years.
functions.comment: Cantonese ho2nang4, meaning: can, be able.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: It's time to take it away!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: [Don't] go back to school!
functions.comment: Cantonese m4sai2, meaning: to not need.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Obediently, [don't] make a mess!
functions.comment: Cantonese m4, ng4; hou2, hou3, meaning: not good (negative imperative, prohibitive).

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: It's twelve now. You [should] go to bed.
functions.comment: Cantonese hou2, meaning: good; can, should.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Grandpa, I [can] do it!
functions.comment: Cantonese dak1, meaning: obtain, get, gain, acquire.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: You [must] go through this.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: There are some questions you [want] to ask me.
functions.comment: Cantonese soeng2, meaning: think, plan, want.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: It [should] not be Miriam Yeung.
functions.comment: Cantonese jing1goi1, meaning: should, ought to.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.example: 主席，任何，一個選舉裏便，最重要嘅兩樣嘢，就[是]候選人嘅資格，與及選民嘅基礎。
functions.exampleen: Chairman, in any election, the two most important things [are] the qualifications of candidates and the base of voters.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: What's the point of meeting?
functions.comment: Cantonese kui2, wui2, wui4, wui5, wui6, meeting: to assemble, meet together.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Did you listen?
functions.comment: Cantonese jau5, meaning: Placed before a verb to emphasize that the action has been done.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: in Cantonese, this form is used only in the high-standard variety, not in colloquial speech
functions.example: 剩落呢啲都[係]冇用㗎喇！
functions.exampleen: The rest are all unusable!
functions.comment: See https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues/653 for a discussion about Chinese copulas.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: I [am] attend[ing] school.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 其實係不[能]參與表決嘅。
functions.exampleen: In fact, it is not possible to participate in the voting.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 我就唔[能夠]根據依一個嘅《議事規則》裏便呢。
functions.exampleen: I [can]'t do it according to one of the Rules of Procedure.
functions.comment: Cantonese nang4gau3, meaning: can, be able to.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: You [have] to stick to it!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: It's time to take it away!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Never heard of 褦!
functions.comment: Cantonese gwo1, gwo3, meaning: pass through.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 唔[需要]同啲客打招呼啦。
functions.exampleen: No [need] to say hello to the guests.
functions.comment: Cantonese seoi1jiu1, meaning: need, require, necessary.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: wei and shi should be interchangeable, this is the simplified character for wei
functions.example: 最近的公交车站[为]九三五厂站。
functions.exampleen: The nearest bus station is 935 Station.
functions.comment: See https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues/653 for a discussion about Chinese copulas.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: [Happy] to spend!
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 樂意.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: After so many years.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 你觉得陈奕迅同杨千嬅最后[会]一起吗？
functions.exampleen: Do you think Eason Chan and Miriam Yang will be together at last?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 在家就阿彌陀佛對[住]四塊牆！ Zàijiā jiù ēmítuófó duì [zhù] sì kuài qiáng!
functions.exampleen: At home, Amitabha [is] facing four walls!

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.deficient: this form is used in colloquial Cantonese and may appear as a loanword in Mandarin Chinese
functions.example: 一行出去就[係]泳池，再行出Ｄ就[係]沙灘！
functions.exampleen: If you go out, it [is] the swimming pool, and if you go out, it [is] the beach!
functions.comment: See https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues/653 for a discussion about Chinese copulas.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 小心[別]跌出來！ Xiǎoxīn [bié] diē chūlái!
functions.exampleen: Be careful [not] to fall out!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 上述款項[可]維持本優惠4個月。 Shàngshù kuǎnxiàng [kě] wéichí běn yōuhuì 4 gè yuè.
functions.exampleen: The above payment [can] maintain this promotion for 4 months.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Grandpa, you can go now!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 四百萬日本人[可能]錯了。 Sìbǎi wàn rìběn rén [kěnéng] cuòle.
functions.exampleen: Four million Japanese [may] be wrong.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 他感到自责，认为这样的复仇超过了[应]有的界限。 Tā gǎndào zìzé, rènwéi zhèyàng de fùchóu chāoguòle [yīng] yǒu de jièxiàn.
functions.exampleen: He felt remorse, believing that such a vengeance went beyond the bounds of what it [should] have been.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 應.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: [应当]注意的是，这种区分在西方语言中是不存在的。 [Yīngdāng] zhùyì de shì, zhè zhǒng qūfēn zài xīfāng yǔyán zhōng shì bù cúnzài de.
functions.exampleen: It [should] be noted that this distinction does not exist in Western languages.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 應當.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 此传统[应该]是在公元6世纪由圣人商羯罗开创。 Cǐ chuántǒng [yīnggāi] shì zài gōngyuán 6 shìjì yóu shèngrén shāng jié luó kāichuàng.
functions.exampleen: This tradition [should] have been started by the sage Shankara in the 6th century AD.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 應該.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 若餘額不足[得]先在站內加值後方可出閘門。 Ruò yú'é bùzú [dé] xiān zài zhànnèi jiā zhí hòufāng kě chū zhámén.
functions.exampleen: If the balance is insufficient, you [must] first add value in the station before you can leave the gate.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 由於嶽麓山緊鄰古城長沙，自古以來是文人墨客[必]游之地，山下有四大書院之一的嶽麓書院，也是中國現今保存最完好的一座古代書院。 Yóuyú yuèlù shān jǐnlín gǔchéng zhǎngshā, zìgǔ yǐlái shì wénrén mòkè [bì] yóu zhī dì, shānxià yǒu sì dà shūyuàn zhī yī de yuèlù shūyuàn, yěshì zhōngguó xiànjīn bǎocún zuì wánhǎo de yīzuò gǔdài shūyuàn.
functions.exampleen: Since Yuelu Mountain is close to the ancient city of Changsha, it has been a [must]-see for scholars and writers since ancient times. There is one of the four major academies at the foot of the mountain, Yuelu Academy, which is also the best-preserved ancient academy in China today.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 由於加拿大在二戰後簽署了聯合國世界人權宣言，加拿大政府[必須]廢除與宣言牴觸的排華法案。 Yóuyú jiānádà zài èrzhàn hòu qiānshǔle liánhéguó shìjiè rénquán xuānyán, jiānádà zhèngfǔ [bìxū] fèichú yǔ xuānyán dǐ chù de pái huá fǎ'àn.
functions.exampleen: Since Canada signed the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights after World War II, the Canadian government [had] to repeal the Chinese Exclusion Act, which contradicted the declaration.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 由于加拿大在二战后签署了联合国世界人权宣言，加拿大政府[必须]废除与宣言牴触的排华法案。 Yóuyú jiānádà zài èrzhàn hòu qiānshǔle liánhéguó shìjiè rénquán xuānyán, jiānádà zhèngfǔ [bìxū] fèichú yǔ xuānyán dǐ chù de pái huá fǎ'àn.
functions.exampleen: Since Canada signed the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights after World War II, the Canadian government [had] to repeal the Chinese Exclusion Act, which contradicted the declaration.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 必須.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 誰會[想]要聽到演員開口說話呢？ Shuí huì [xiǎng] yào tīngdào yǎnyuán kāikǒu shuōhuà ne?
functions.exampleen: Who [wants] to hear an actor speak?

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 因为西班牙[不愿]赋予古巴独立 Yīnwèi xībānyá [bùyuàn] fùyǔ gǔbā dúlì

functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 願.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 那也是你的一部份呀，所以，我[愿意]接受。 Nà yěshì nǐ de yī bù fèn ya, suǒyǐ, wǒ [yuànyì] jiēshòu.
functions.exampleen: That's part of you too, so I'm [willing] to accept it.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 願意.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 他感到自責，認為這樣的復仇超過了[應]有的界限。 Tā gǎndào zìzé, rènwéi zhèyàng de fùchóu chāoguòle [yīng] yǒu de jièxiàn.
functions.exampleen: He felt remorse, believing that such a vengeance went beyond the bounds of what it [should] have been.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: [應當]注意的是，這種區分在西方語言中是不存在的。 [Yīngdāng] zhùyì de shì, zhè zhǒng qūfēn zài xīfāng yǔyán zhōng shì bù cúnzài de.
functions.exampleen: It [should] be noted that this distinction does not exist in Western languages.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 此傳統[應該]是在公元6世紀由聖人商羯羅開創。 Cǐ chuántǒng [yīnggāi] shì zài gōngyuán 6 shìjì yóu shèngrén shāng jié luó kāichuàng.
functions.exampleen: This tradition [should] have been started by the sage Shankara in the 6th century AD.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 自此以後，沒有人[敢]再有諫爭之言了。 Zì cǐ yǐhòu, méiyǒu rén [gǎn] zài yǒu jiàn zhēng zhī yánle.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 你覺得陳奕迅同楊千嬅最後[會]一起嗎？

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: [Happy] to spend!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 典型的果汁機有著類似花瓶的容器乘裝[欲]打碎食材。 Diǎnxíng de guǒzhī jī yǒuzhe lèisì huāpíng de róngqì chéng zhuāng [yù] dǎ suì shícái.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate

functions.example: 但可以舉一事[爲]例，他說他喜歡涉覽筆記，中國的，他幾乎都看過。

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 有議員沒有合理理由而在你身後及旁邊站[着]。
functions.exampleen: There are members who stand behind and beside you for no reasonable reason.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 他才[肯]將採購權交給皮宗教。 Tā cái [kěn] jiāng cǎigòu quán jiāo gěi pí zōngjiào.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 他幼年受過良好的教育，通曉拉丁語和希臘語，[能]誦荷馬史詩原文，併到雅典學過哲學。 Tā yòunián shòuguò liánghǎo de jiàoyù, tōngxiǎo lādīng yǔ hé xīlà yǔ, [néng] sòng hé mǎ shǐshī yuánwén, bìng dào yǎdiǎn xuéguò zhéxué.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 但需等到中国足协杯赛事结束后方可确定是否[能够]直接晋级小组赛。 Dàn xū děngdào zhōngguó zúxié bēi sàishì jiéshù hòufāng kě quèdìng shìfǒu [nénggòu] zhíjiē jìnjí xiǎozǔ sài.
functions.exampleen: But it needs to wait until the end of the Chinese Football Association Cup before it can be determined whether [can] directly advance to the group stage.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 但需等到中國足協杯賽事結束後方可確定是否[能夠]直接晉級小組賽。 Dàn xū děngdào zhōngguó zúxié bēi sàishì jiéshù hòufāng kě quèdìng shìfǒu [nénggòu] zhíjiē jìnjí xiǎozǔ sài.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 有議員沒有合理理由而在你身後及旁邊站[著]。

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 所有事情皆[被]正式確認後，才展開選舉程序呢？

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 區位論[要]解決的是經濟活動的地理方位及其形成原因的問題。 Qūwèi lùn [yào] jiějué de shì jīngjì huódòng dì dìlǐ fāngwèi jí qí xíngchéng yuányīn de wèntí.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: [該]取走的都取走了！ [Gāi] qǔ zǒu de dōu qǔ zǒule!
functions.exampleen: All that [should] be taken away!

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: [该]取走的都取走了！ [Gāi] qǔ zǒu de dōu qǔ zǒule!
functions.exampleen: All that [should] be taken away!
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 該.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Haven't heard of it?
functions.comment: experiencial perfective; simplified counterpart of 過

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.exampleen: Haven't heard of it?
functions.comment: experiencial perfective; traditional counterpart of 过

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 這些顯然都是台灣媒體所[需]大力加強的。 Zhèxiē xiǎnrán dōu shì táiwān méitǐ suǒ [xū] dàlì jiāqiáng de.
functions.exampleen: These are clearly what the Taiwanese media [needs] to strengthen.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 此處不[需要]保護補給線的安全而持續控制。 Cǐ chù bù [xūyào] bǎohù bǔjǐxiàn de ānquán ér chíxù kòngzhì.
functions.exampleen: There is no [need] for constant control to secure supply lines here.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 1860年簽訂的中俄北京條約中規定清政府[須]將此地大部份割予沙俄，今歸俄羅斯濱海邊疆區所管。 1860 nián qiāndìng de zhōng é běijīng tiáoyuē zhōng guīdìng qīng zhèngfǔ [xū] jiāng cǐdì dà bù fèn gē yǔ shā'é, jīn guī èluósī bīnhǎi biānjiāng qū suǒguǎn.
functions.exampleen: The Sino-Russian Beijing Treaty signed in 1860 stipulated that the Qing government [must] cede most of this land to Tsarist Russia, which is now under the control of Russia's Primorsky Territory.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 因為西班牙[不願]賦予古巴獨立 Yīnwèi xībānyá [bùyuàn] fùyǔ gǔbā dúlì
functions.exampleen: Because of Spain's [reluctance] to grant Cuba independence

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 那也是你的一部份呀，所以，我[願意]接受。 Nà yěshì nǐ de yī bù fèn ya, suǒyǐ, wǒ [yuànyì] jiēshòu.
functions.exampleen: That's part of you too, so I'm [willing] to accept it.

functions.rule: combination of the auxiliary and the main verb
functions.example: 1860年签订的中俄北京条约中规定清政府[须]将此地大部份割予沙俄，今归俄罗斯滨海边疆区所管。 1860 nián qiāndìng de zhōng é běijīng tiáoyuē zhōng guīdìng qīng zhèngfǔ [xū] jiāng cǐdì dà bù fèn gē yǔ shā'é, jīn guī èluósī bīnhǎi biānjiāng qū suǒguǎn.
functions.exampleen: The Sino-Russian Beijing Treaty signed in 1860 stipulated that the Qing government [must] cede most of this land to Tsarist Russia, which is now under the control of Russia's Primorsky Territory.
functions.comment: This is the simplified counterpart of traditional 須.

functions.rule: combination of the copula and a nonverbal predicate
functions.exampleen: I was cold.
